intro: Trigynaea boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian trigynaea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
